title: Hey. I won all of my ten provisionals. And Got placed into bronze 4. What's with that?
body: Is it because of me playing support all ten games? Or is it something else? My friend won 2 games and lost 8 , and got placed into bronze 2. Rito p10x ;-;

replies.body: Congratulations on winning you placement matches!  While winning  is an impressive achievement, it's not necessarily a golden ticket.  The placement matches will consider some of your previous season standing and continues to adjust your MMR until it finds the best fit for you.  We also have a [Ranked Play](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204010760-Ranked-Play-FAQ#h12) guide that provides additional information on placements and ranked in general that I hope might help.  Placing doesn't lock you into the tier or division, so you can totally climb the ranks as you continue to play.  Best of luck!

I just want to say here, that the quote "so you can totally climb the ranks as you continue to play" is a SEVERE misrepresentation of the difficulty it is to climb.  I hear time and time again "if you are good enough you will climb".  That may be true for a diamond skilled player to climb out of bronze, but much less true for, say a mid silver level player, to climb out of bronze.  This has historically frustrated me to no end.  Currently, in this season, I have approximately a 50/50 win rate.  I may be 1 or 2 games above the .500 mark.  I tried as hard as I could the vast majority of this season to climb out of bronze with support.  I ranged between a 15-20 game over .500 and never climbed higher than Bronze 1.  On the flip side, there are plenty of gold/silver with a much lower win rate than .500.  Understanding their competition is more skilled, but so are their team mates.  Just a rant from years of frustration.  My gamertag is the leper con if you want to review my history.  I have been on major tilt these last games, branching out to roles I may not usually play, and suffering for it, but you can review my history as a whole.
